# stop()

**Instance Method**

Stops playback and undoes the setup the system requires for playback.

## Declaration

```swift
func stop()
```

## Discussion

Calling this method undoes the resource allocation the system performs in [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioPlayer/prepareToPlay()] or [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioPlayer/play()]. It doesn’t reset the player’s [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioPlayer/currentTime] value to `0`, so playback resumes from where it stops.

## Controlling playback

- **prepareToPlay()**: Prepares the player for audio playback.
- **play()**: Plays audio asynchronously.
- **play(atTime:)**: Plays audio asynchronously, starting at a specified point in the audio output device’s timeline.
- **pause()**: Pauses audio playback.
- **isPlaying**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the player is currently playing audio.
